import React from 'react' import Container from 'react-bootstrap/Container' import Col from 'react-bootstrap/Col' import Row from 'react-bootstrap/Row' const Work = () => { return(

Work page

Current Work

  Data Science Education Intern // Program Assistant

Started: May 2019

Description:

I assist with the development of courses intended for my academic department's newly-launching Masters of Applied Data Science ("MADS").

Responsibilities:

  • Sourcing, review, and curation of educational material & data sets
  • Design of assessments (quizzes, homeworks), as well as homework-autograders
  • Design of interactive educational / tutorial content, often interactive iPython/Jupyter notebooks
  • Beta testing courses that have completed development, prior to their launch window
  • Implementing corrections and alterations based on the feedback of quality-assurance and beta-testing staff

Past Work

  Instructional Aide for SI 206 - (Intermediate) Data-Oriented Programming

Winter 2019 Semester (Jan - April)

Description:

I'm a member of the teaching team for a course that serves as continued programming education for informatics students; this is typically their secondary programming course and focuses on assorted skills and applications of Python while introducing SQL.

Topic Include: Databasing (SQL, SQLite3), Web Scraping+Crawling, API's requiring keys and/or OAuth, continued exposure to Git for version control, and review of unit testing and the principles of object-oriented programming (focusing on subclassing)

Responsibilities:

Ultimately, I was there to help students understand new programminng concepts and troubleshoot their code.

Regularly provided assistance during the weekly lectures (of approximately 140 students) and in a smaller lab section managed by a Graduate-Student Instructor. Additionally provided feedback through an online course discussion-board and conducted grading & exam-proctoring.

  Instructional Aide for SI 110 - Introduction to Information Studies

Winter 2019 Semester (Jan - April)

Description:

I was a member of the instruction team for an introductory course required of students pursuing admission to the BSI program; the course provides a very broad overview of the history, issues, and opportunities for professionals interested in the information/technology sector.

Responsibilities:

IA's for this course attend weekly staff meetings, mentor check-ins, and communicating grading and revisionary feedback to students.

  Residential Advisor - Stockwell Hall

From September of 2017 to May 2019

Description:

After working in Residential Staff as a Community Center Assistant for the summer, I decided to interview for the chance to become a Residential Advisor the upcoming fall. I placed in Stockwell Hall for Junior year, decided to remain for the summer concurrent to my research internship, and ended up staying for Senior year as well.

Responsibilities:

An RA is never truly "off the clock." A large portion of the job is building community within the hall, as well as the building as a whole. Getting to know residents quickly and as well as possible is critical, but we also place an emphasis on ensuring a safe and respectful environment. We have weekly staff meetings, biweekly check-ins with our Hall Director, regular front-desk work shifts, and regular monthly on-call shifts.

  Research Intern (Summer 2018)

From June 2018 to December 2018

I spent my post-junior summer as a research intern assisting with a literature review initiative intended to better organize and analyze research focusing on how factors in humans, groups, and robotic systems can impact humans' experiences and perceptions of human-robot interactions.

Basically all of my time was spent reading through massive sets of scholarly publications and reporting on various characteristics of the studies, highlighting methodology, commonly-used hardware, sample size, variables of interest, etc.

  Research Intern (Winter 2018)

From January 2018 to June 2018

I took a winter-term internship my junior year assisting UMSI professor Douglas Van Houweling , an Internet Hall of Fame Inductee as part of an NSF-sponsored project to promote the examination and preservation of early-internet history, specifically focusing on network development and commercialization of networking between 1980 and 1996.

Most of my work was processing interviews conducted by the professor and his colleagues, resolving issues in any automated transcriptions as well as presenting written summaries of key factors from each interview, including vital topics, individuals, and organizations discussed.

  Community Center Assistant - Northwood Campus Apartments

From April 2017 to August 2017

Summer after my sophomore year, I decided to take a Residential Staff position working as a clerical assistant for the housing offices // community-centers for UMich's Northwood Apartment complexes. Most of my job was actually using some database software to administrate building access, catalogue keys, and parking passes. I was also in charge of managing packages, move-in/move-out processing, and being a liaison between residents, admin, and contractors.

Sales Associate - UGo's (Student Retail)

From June 2017 to January 2018

I worked a pretty standard retail job for a university-owned convenience store one summer, and on-and-off through the fall semester. I got experience running register, accounting money and inventory, and managing various pop-up problems on-the-fly (difficult customers, rush, hardware/software/machinery failure, etc.)

I also figured out I unironically just really enjoy working retail.

  English Tutor // Essay Editor // Wordsmith

September 2015 Onwards

Pretty much all throughout college I've been helping people with essays, applications, and mission statements, sometimes compensated, sometimes volunteer. Language is one of the things I've always been gifted at and I enjoy being able to use that to help people.

  Landscape Worker

From May 2011 to August 2015

I was a seasonal assistant for a local landscaping company; most of my work was a blend of cleaning up to ensure operations could proceed at optimal pace and also keeping peoples' unattended kids from running up to dangerous heavy machinery.

) } export default Work
